channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Travelers Need to Know About the Shutdown, Flight Reductions and Delays

item.title: White House strikes deals for lower prices on obesity drugs
item.description: Medicare beneficiaries will soon be able to get obesity and Type 2 diabetes drugs for a $50 copay. But there are some limitations.

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to prohibit gender election on passports
item.description: The court's decision is not a final ruling, however; it just permits Trump's passport policy to go into effect while litigation continues in the lower...

item.title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Trump Transgender Passport Policy
item.description: A lower court judge had temporarily blocked the administration’s policy requiring that passports reflect sex as found on an original birth certificate...

item.title: COP30 Begins With U.S. Allies and Rivals Alike Calling for Action
item.description: The calls for action on opening day stood in sharp contrast to the position of the President Trump, who has called global warming a “con job.”

item.title: Key Questions From Conservative Justices in the Tariffs Case
item.description: A lively argument spanning almost three hours featured illuminating exchanges that tested the usual commitments of some of the justices on the right s...

item.title: Trump Announces Deal to Drop Obesity Drug Prices to as Little as $149 a Month
item.description: President Trump announced a deal with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk to lower prices on hugely popular weight-loss drugs for Medicare, Medicaid and Americ...

item.title: Subway sandwich thrower found not guilty in D.C. jury rebuke
item.description: The acquittal on a misdemeanor charge comes after the case came to represent broader resistance in the nation's capital to the Trump administration's ...

item.title: 50 years ago, the Edmund Fitzgerald, a 'rock star' ship, sank in Lake Superior
item.description: Twenty-nine sailors drowned when the Edmund Fitzgerald went down in the Great Lakes' icy waters on Nov. 10, 1975. The ship was immortalized in a surpr...

item.title: After California's vote to counter Trump, here's where redistricting stands
item.description: In the summer, Texas drew new lines to help the GOP win in the midterm elections. California countered this week. The Republicans might have an edge i...

item.title: Paramilitary Group in Sudan Agrees to Cease-Fire Proposal
item.description: The paramilitary group Rapid Support Forces agreed to a cease-fire proposal after growing condemnation of atrocities in Darfur. Sudan’s military reite...

item.description: The calls for action on opening day stood in sharp contrast to the position of the President Trump, who has called global warming a “con job.”

item.title: Ed Moloney, Chronicler of the Troubles in Northern Ireland, Dies at 77
item.description: He wrote a history of the Irish Republican Army and directed a project that secretly collected oral histories of paramilitary fighters.

item.title: Iran Sentences Iranian American Jewish Man to Prison, Family Says
item.description: Kamran Hekmati of Long Island was arrested for visiting Israel 13 years ago to celebrate his son’s bar mitzvah, they said.
